document.title: History and Social Science Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

189BF986D8D1439EAE3E79F9FA032279.description:
describing economic interdependence, including the rise of multinational corporations,
international organizations, and trade agreements.

FC5C802D52BA4B1B82602D94A18D6ED8.description:
analyzing the increasing impact, events, and conditions that have given rise to international
terrorism, including, but not limited to the U.S. Embassy bombing in Beirut, the Lockerbie
Bombing of Pan AM Flight 103, the U.S. Embassy bombings in Nairobi and Kenya, and
the 2011 Breivik shootings; and

9B4741F2CE3F414BA669A66578A82275.description:
examine the development, role, and effects of technology, including social media and
chemical and biological technologies;

812A3D275F044865BB5555D570100601.description:
identifying contemporary economic and political issues and ethnic and religious conflicts
resulting in the migrations of refugees;

61F3F5FCA599494594664FAEE7653580.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to explain global changes during the
21st century by

5D15C5E3F147478D92705CF9641F93FF.description: explaining the effects of decolonization and other methods of gaining independence.

CC01DEDB45934AAABBE044BE041812EA.description:
describing the end of the League of Nations’ mandate system and the creation of states in
the Middle East, including the roles of Golda Meir and Gamal Abdel Nasser; and

E87BC8E16E324E0984C1FF787EB93005.description:
describing the struggles for self-rule, including Gandhi’s leadership and the development of
India’s democracy;

3058CD01DB704C3CA25B88E57D9498B3.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to identify the political, economic, and
socioeconomic aspects of independence movements and decolonization by

5095EDABD3AB46D7A682F2A1FA3DC076.description: analyzing how nations around the world developed a culture of global interdependence.

16AB43FCDAB54601B6098888C7703A3B.description:
examining the political and economic causes and global consequences of the breakup of the
Soviet Union; and

7F91C0CDF7E34574A78AB20EAC5D0CDD.description: describing conflicts, events, and major leaders in Asia, including Mao Zedong, Chiang Kaishek, Deng Xiaoping, and Ho Chi Minh, and Tiananmen Square;

549399BFCE2C422A9EB5AA7DF9037D80.description:
describing the events, conflicts, and revolutionary movements, including, but not limited to
the Berlin Blockade, the Suez Canal Crisis, the Hungarian Revolution, the Bay of Pigs, the
Cuban Missile Crisis, and the Prague Spring, as well as the impact of clandestine
operations on the Cold War;

F6137AD4968B4C0BA9C7D3EC130A1DF6.description:
explaining the causes, the domino theory, the role of containment, and the differences
between the United States and Soviet Union economic and political systems;

49D42F01D1F34D1CA04A12483348689E.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to understand the significance of the
Cold War during the second half of the 20th century by

70779B32C7FD4E07A0DAC82D93D317AA.description:
describing the heroic aspects, including, but not limited to D-Day, the French Resistance,
the Dunkirk Evacuation, covert action, and Operation Jedburgh.

510811F499764879B67E7E884C54AD5D.description:
examining the effects of the war, with emphasis on the terms of the peace, the war crimes
trials, the division of Europe, plans to rebuild Germany and Japan, the creation of
international cooperative organizations, the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (1948),
and the creation and defense of the modern state of Israel; and

77094022450D4310A6FA54E553BB9B94.description:
describing key causes, events, victims, and impacts of the Holocaust, including
antisemitism, the rise of the Nazi Party, Kristallnacht, the establishment of ghettos,
concentration and death camps, mobile killing squads, rescue, Jewish resistance, and
liberation;

50D35F854F224C0989375BB4CAB29A63.description: describing the major battles, including, but not limited to Leningrad, Midway, Normandy, Okinawa, and Stalingrad;

A45E685ACE454DEFA247C4EB06479A35.description:
explaining economic and political causes and identifying major events and leaders of the
war, including, but not limited to Winston Churchill, Dwight Eisenhower, Adolf Hitler,
Michinomiya Hirohito, Joseph Stalin, Douglas MacArthur, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Harry
Truman, and Admiral Chester Nimitz;

9F25F1F6C3BA4F338ECAD4559317511A.description: The student will apply history and social science skills to understand World War II by

5407C07DFE1849EB8D17C7606754439F.description: explaining the causes and effects of worldwide depression in the 1930s; and

4005DEDD43BC4B69A2509948181905ED.description: identifying the causes and consequences of the Russian Revolution;

C6673D93F0A84D13BDE1A584E2B539A4.description:
analyzing and explaining the terms of the Treaty of Versailles, the actions of the League of
Nations, and the mandate system;

6263A96789514ED3B1FE4A203CBF3E04.description:
describing major battles, including, but not limited to Gallipoli, Marne, Meuse-Argonne,
Somme, and Verdun;

5684D4AB6A19459682F55D5E3C72BF59.description:
identifying the changes to modern warfare exemplified in battles along the Eastern and
Western fronts;

B422F1A20CF6428FB507B758B1C5A041.description: The student will apply history and social science skills to understand World War I by

A09C253927C549AD9139B7E1A50F2707.description: explaining the events related to the unification of Germany and the role of Bismarck.

61662B3607354406ABD121F88BA59EFB.description:
explaining the events related to the unification of Italy and the role of Italian nationalism;
and

D8138ED3245840FB9B31A5C5C7C9A67B.description:
evaluating responses to imperialism, including, but not limited to the Sepoy Mutiny and the
Boxer Rebellion;

8B30668729D843B38E1928A6DD40AC5B.description: analyzing the effects of the First and Second Industrial Revolutions;

BD98AAD24B544C37B5C8658CB91A9306.description:
explaining the roles of resources, capital, and entrepreneurship in developing an industrial
economy;

ECCAA02E6C5D423CABEC9DCA15F66A89.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze the global impact of changes
in European nations between 1800 and 1900 by

9F9AE98BBDB64E6AB5EFCC01E59F8230.description:
identifying trading partners, resources, and products exchanged with major Central and
Southern African empires.

9598044B74D04A96AC8EF7BB2226A6C3.description:
analyzing the adoption of African Christianity in Kongo and comparing it to the practice
of Indigenous religions in the Zulu Empire; and

8688ACE5A9F045BF90A97AEDAF46BD77.description: examining the Swahili trade network and its impacts on Eastern Africa;

9299FDF14B6247EAABB31F0D03AAE873.description:
analyzing the role of the Ashanti and other powerful Western African empires in the
Transatlantic Slave Trade;

3F3CAE95E2F44FF08DB93F53150C7BD9.description: explaining the influence of Askia Muhammad in the region;

0FBC26AA2004426C94FA26706B398FA1.description: describing the location and development of Eastern and Western Africa;

7220617BDEA24536AFF1D70D0D64F62C.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to understand sub-Saharan Africa from
approximately 1500 A.D. to approximately 1800 A.D. by

EEA6F8E9FE8B43249B43DE57D0064D60.description:
describing the location, origins, and development of Japan, including, but not limited to
the incentives and consequences of the Tokugawa shogunate’s closed-country policy, the
roles of important figures in Japanese society, such as the Emperor and the Shogun, and
the importance of religion in Japanese society.

9B017B850C9241CB90C85FB1C49E34D8.description:
describing the location, origins, and development of China, including, but not
limited to the expansion, development, and social and cultural patterns within the
Ming and Qing (Manchu) dynasties; and

AAE65E351691477BA25D3174562C0D1E.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to understand Asia from approximately
1500 A.D. to approximately 1800 A.D. by

97A693D2AD0E4A7CAA3109326DCA262C.description: assessing the effect of Napoleon and the Congress of Vienna on political power in Europe.

AF739F82490C47129C106DE585C93218.description:
explaining the influence of the American Revolution on the causes and effects of the
French and Latin American Revolutions; and

CF6C19CC99C84FE5BAA538928EF219EC.description:
describing the development of constitutional monarchy in Great Britain, with emphasis on
the English Civil War and the Glorious Revolution and their impacts on democracy;

F97854C19BFF420FB05CB8BC03F485BD.description:
describing the Age of Absolutism with emphasis on the development of France and Louis
XIV and the Hapsburg empire and Charles V;

CEF3F79A7D98468EAB0124A73D600E82.description:
analyzing Enlightenment themes and how they influenced the political foundations of
Virginia and the United States;

76A1039DF1B24FEBBAC23F28625BC516.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze the political, socio-cultural,
geographic, religious, and economic conditions in Europe, Russia, and the Americas that led to
political unrest and revolution from approximately 1500 (A.D.) to about 1800 by

4A837AC224D142D689484777A0791696.description:
analyzing how competition for colonies among Britain, France, and Spain changed the
economic system of Europe.

DDC68E57B855479B8906265037A624B7.description:
explaining the political, social, cultural, and economic goals of European exploration and
colonization;

54B042D03E314D29B75C0ACEBDB5C0F2.description: The student will apply history and social science skills to describe European exploration by

2832DF802B8948D78A09F6A52DC6D878.description:
describing the effect of religious conflicts on society and government actions, including,
but not limited to the Inquisition and the Catholic Reformation.

53525035C73D47E6BC95B0A79177847C.description:
describing how the Renaissance and Reformation led to changing cultural values,
traditions, and philosophies and the role of the printing press in disseminating these changes; and

D9BA89F29406427C84619C11116D7D5B.description:
explaining the effects of the theological, political, and economic differences that emerged,
including the views and actions of Martin Luther, John Calvin, Henry VIII, and Elizabeth I;

41FF3E9A12D145E19A41B41FE3B9E186.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze the Renaissance and
Protestant Reformation in terms of their impacts on Western civilization by

0B4C4F69D27244B9B35173EF1558D0E0.description:
analyzing major trade patterns, regional and global interactions, cultural exchanges,
technological, and scientific exchanges.

F6917AC0EC8D4F4989CC0FE75C5E7BF8.description:
describing the beliefs, sacred writings, traditions, customs, and growth of major religions,
including, but not limited to Buddhism, Christianity, Hinduism, Islam, Judaism, and
Sikhism; and

9F01BBA3F8B845B88C2937D633D44B4D.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze the political, cultural,
geographic, and economic conditions in the world around 1500 A.D. by

AD293C1BAB16499A9634EF8EC6240242.description:
contextualizing and corroborating sources for credibility, propaganda, and bias to
determine patterns and trends to understand the modern world.

B6CF8178A3A04E5FAE288831DDAFD52B.description:
developing products that reflect an understanding of research and content to make
real-life connections; and

1E192673E0DE4B87A11C7C05C55F6D2C.description:
engaging and communicating as an informed individual with different
perspectives;

16CA382E30FE472C8A9EB777B4AF5763.description: determining cause and effect to analyze connections;

D22A4D09586E431B8012E1DA551ACA0B.description:
comparing and contrasting historical, cultural, economic, and political
perspectives;

A9BE9C0F5D7042BAA73C5DCD5B364BAB.description:
investigating and analyzing evidence from multiple sources to construct arguments
and draw conclusions;

41BF10DA2E114692B85CC82BD302CCC4.description: questioning to construct arguments, using evidence from multiple sources;

C218C523F8C74B3FA7B0788EBFE79153.description:
applying geographic skills to determine and predict patterns and trends of people,
places, and events;

F7B8079EE45A45E6AD12ED42E2546D48.description: The student will apply history and social science skills to the content by
